title: Walkabout: the Chauvel's legendary journey...
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Port Augusta (S. Aust.)
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Coober Pedy (S. Aust.)
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Television
description: Originally produced for British television in 1958 this thirteen part series follows internationally renowned Australian filmmakers Charles Chauvel and Elsa Chauvel on a 3,000 mile journey through Australia. Setting off from Sydney they travel across the Great Dividing Range, heading westward to the outback "dead heart" of Australia through Central Australia and on to the Northern Territory. They look at the outback with all its "bewildering contradictions" - deserts, pasturelands, wide grasslands, opal country, mountain ranges and rivers - join a cattle muster, catch brumbies, observe unique wildlife and visit Aboriginal communities. The series is a time capsule of Australian outback life in the middle of the twentieth century reflecting the attitudes held by white Australians towards Aboriginal peoples and the land at the time. Narrated by Elsa and Charles Chauvel.
